topic: Previous-Year Mixed Practice & Full Revision System
theory: Previous-Year Mixed Practice & Full Revision System is an important topic in Quantitative Aptitude. Start with basic concepts, then learn standard methods and shortcuts. Practice easy questions first and move to timed mixed questions.
all_approaches: Understand the core definition and common question patterns.
Break each question into known facts and unknown target.
Use elimination when options are close.
Track mistakes and revise formulas/patterns daily.

examples.question: Sample Previous-Year Mixed Practice & Full Revision System question 1
examples.solution: Identify the main rule and solve step by step.

examples.question: Sample Previous-Year Mixed Practice & Full Revision System question 2
examples.solution: Apply the shortcut method and verify with options.

practice_questions: 1. Solve 5 easy questions from Previous-Year Mixed Practice & Full Revision System.
3. Create short notes for Previous-Year Mixed Practice & Full Revision System formulas/rules.
4. Attempt one mixed set and review mistakes.
